intro: Latreillea glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds, which then disperse its seeds. It is native to parts of South America and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments. Its parasitic nature allows it to obtain water and nutrients from its host, while still performing photosynthesis.
